properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 9 at 7:41PM CST by NWS Aberdeen SD
properties.description:
Southwest winds may become strong and gusty over the northeast
part of South Dakota later tonight through Monday morning.
Combined with the recent fresh snow that some parts of the
Prairie Coteau received early Sunday morning, areas of blowing
and drifting snow are possible, especially between the Summit and
Bruce exits of Interstate 29, as well as on U.S. Highways 12 and
212 and South Dakota Highways 15, 20, 22 and 28.

Travel impacts are possible, especially during the Monday morning
commute, due to reduced visibility, drifting snow and slick
roads. If you plan to travel across the northeast portion of the
state later tonight or Monday morning, take extra precautions.

NWSheadline: STRONG WINDS AND BLOWING SNOW POSSIBLE OVER FAR NORTHEAST SOUTH DAKOTA LATE TONIGHT INTO MONDAY MORNING
